com.example.sulemaia.Model

Class PathManualTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.sulemaia.Model.PathManualTree

  • public class PathManualTree
extends Object
    Whole class for the creation of the tree that belongs to the manual gameplay (i.e.: when the game is not running with automatic algorithms like A*, Uniform Cost or BestCost.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PathManualTree.Node
      Public class that contains all the attributes of the node that corresponds to a Manual Tree (Different from a Heuristic Tree Node).

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private HashSet<PathManualTree.Node> visitedInExpanded 
      private HashSet<PathManualTree.Node> visitedNodes 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PathManualTree(PathManualTree.Node anchor)
      Initialize a graphViz tree with an initial node received by parameter, which is the anchor.

      Method to check if the node already exist as a child, so we wont repeat nodes, or even that we have the chance to change it to another father to correct the flow of the tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathManualTree

        public PathManualTree(PathManualTree.Node anchor)
        Initialize a graphViz tree with an initial node received by parameter, which is the anchor.
        Parameters:
        anchor - initial node for the tree.

    • Method Detail

      • addNodeToInvalidNodes

        public void addNodeToInvalidNodes(PathManualTree.Node node)
        this method adds a node to a list of inaccessible nodes
        Parameters:
        node - node to set inaccessible

      • addNode

        public void addNode(PathManualTree.Node father,
                    PathManualTree.Node child)
        This method adds a child to the specified node. If the father already has that node, child is not added
        Parameters:
        father - parent node
        child - child node

      • addMovement

        public void addMovement(PathManualTree.Node child)
        Create a step movement between father and child
        Parameters:
        child - final node

      • exists

        public boolean exists(PathManualTree.Node child)
        Method to check if the node already exist as a child, so we wont repeat nodes, or even that we have the chance to change it to another father to correct the flow of the tree.
        Parameters:
        child - Child node to look for.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if we find the node or not.

      • endTree

        public void endTree()
        We have to manually end the tree, again, so the nodes wont be displayed in an incorrect order on the graphic implementation. This is rather complicated because a lot of things have to be taken in account for the manual gameplay. All these problems are out of the panorama when the game is played automatically by any algorithm.

      • drawTree

        private void drawTree(PathManualTree.Node node)
        We draw the tree node by node checking which nodes are the actual node's children.
        Parameters:
        node - Father node to look for children.

      • getDotTree

        public String getDotTree()
        Get the source for the tree creation from the GraphViz class. This is part of the configuration of the URL to create the tree in the git.
        Returns:
        a dot-language source for the tree.

      • setInitial

        public void setInitial(PathManualTree.Node node)
        Set a certain node as the initial node for the graphical implementation.
        Parameters:
        node - The original node to initiate the graphic tree.

      • setFinal

        public void setFinal(PathManualTree.Node node)
        Set a certain node as the final node for the graphical implementation.
        Parameters:
        node - The final node to get the graphic tree to an end.
